header.title: ‘FRUSTRATING!’ Aldi accused of GENDER BIAS by outraged MALE shopper
header.subtitle: AN ALDI’S newly-opened store has outraged man who found the signs marking parking spot for families “a little frustrating in 2018”.
header.postText: 'The newly-opened Aldi branch in Otford Road, Sevenoaks, Kent, has enraged a male shopper who accused the German supermarket chain of gender inequality.', 'Following his visit to the shop, which was launched two weeks ago, the man, who asked to remain anonymous, found upsetting that car parkings reserved to families where marked in white paint with a woman holding a child’s hand.', 'In his opinion, markings should not portray any specific gender.', 'He said: Does this mean Aldi are expecting only women and mothers to go shopping?', 'Should fathers and men park elsewhere? They are happy with the child having no obvious gender.', 'I wanted to highlight the issue as its a little frustrating in 2018.', 'It seems that the onus is still on women that they must raise the family and manage this – which is unfair.', 'I guess its more of an unconscious bias that we have in us, and we are all guilty at various times.', 'It was just something that irritated me.', 'I was surprised and disappointed that a store like Aldi, who seems to want to be the newcomer to the area and market, would have an old fashioned way of thinking.', 'Aldi use Team GB to promote their brand and we are, as a society, trying to be more equal – especially within sports.', 'Express.co.uk has contacted Aldi for a comment.', 'Other supermarket chains in Kent have created parking spaces for families.', 'However, they have used markings showing genderless parents and children or have included both men and women.', This latest allegation of sexism comes after several companies rebranded a number products seen as sexist by social media campaigns and customers.', 'Waitrose has pledged to rebrand its Gentleman’s Smoked Chicken Caesar Roll, as the gender specification has been perceived sexist by many customers.', 'And Kleenex rebranded one of its most iconic products launched in 1956, the Mansize tissue box, renaming it Extra Large.', 'A social media user demanded the name of the product to be changed writing on Twitter: Hi @Kleenex_UK. My four year old son asked me what was written here.', 'Then he asked, why are they called mansize?', Can girls, boys and mummies use them?', 'I said: 'I don’t know and yes of course.', 'He suggests you should call them ‘very large tissues’. It is 2018.', 'Another Twitter user said: In this day and age, is it right for @Kleenex_UK to have a product that is MANsized?', 'The world is changing maybe they should too? #BOUCRY', A spokesperson for Kimberly-Clark, Kleenex’s parent company, said: Kleenex Mansize tissues have been on shelves for the past 60 years. The brand has been characterised by a much larger tissue size, which is both soft and durable.', 'It was launched at a time when large cotton handkerchiefs were still very popular and Kleenex offered a unique disposable alternative. To this day, it remains one of our most popular products, with over 3.4 million people buying the tissues every year.', 'We are always grateful to customers who take time to tell us how our products can be improved, and we carefully consider all suggestions. Thanks to recent feedback we are now rebranding our Mansize tissues to Kleenex Extra Large.'

commentThread.commentText: I was under the impression it was identifying a ma...See more
GET A LIFE, what does it matter.  Nelsons column has a bloke on top, is that wrong as well
Does winning the fight against Snowflakes mean that you eventually become one?

replies.commentText: Sort of, its more like using their own strategy against them though...Rather than actually being upset like they are.

commentThread.commentText: If he gets "upset" about this he needs to seek help.

We are NOT, as a society, trying to be more equal – especially within sports. Will we really accept that a man can decide he wants to be referred to as a female so he can enter women's sports events such as weight-lifting, boxing or wrestling, for example, and be considered fair and equal?
The complaining shopper has plenty of time for this sort of nonsense.
Obviously a sad little man who just wants to find anything to complain about. Next he will be complaining that white paint has been used.
Another sad so called man with nothing better to say or do. When will they get a life and leave the rest of us alone?.

Time to stop denigrating males on television ads. Almost every advertisement on television that feature a male or males portrays the male or males to be stupid or inept or just plain useless. They would never portray females like the way they do males. There is already a war against boys and we should not want them growing into adulthood thinking that they are going to be like Mr bean no matter how funny he is.

replies.commentText: How? A big X with a smaller x? But that will annoy all the big Y’s and little y’s....They could just make more car park spaces.

That would just frustrate non English speakers and confuse the dyslexic. We have to cater for everyone in our inclusive society these days otherwise there is going to be someone somewhere who will be offended.

commentThread.commentText: Shut up and if you don't like the symbols shop elsewhere without whingeing about it.

replies.commentText: Just ignore it,many shoppers do.same with disability parking.

I don’t get het up about it,it just means it’s a longer ride for my wife on her disability scooter,and the longer walk helps to keep me mobile.wish she was fit and able then I wouldn’t have the boring chore of shopping,

commentThread.commentText: surely the spaces for women and kids should be furthest from the shop so they can get some exercise and combat the obesity from which both seem to be suffering more and more ?

replies.commentText: You are correct....one hones caller to a radio program said that she didn't need to be right next to the door when disabled bays were sometimes farther away, "all we need is wider bays so we can get child seats in and out etc..........the other side of the carpark would do as long as they were wide bays"

commentThread.commentText: If this moaning bloke wants to be equal on everything like the girls he should go clean behind the fridge. Dope.

replies.commentText: Most of the time men have to do it.
Men do clean behind the fridge, usually when we put a new kitchen in!

commentThread.commentText: Quite right, long past time to fight back against the feminist entitlement brigade

replies.commentText: Yup, but not over a bit of white paint on the floor...I am going to believe the drawing was more clothing related than anything.
Better to pick your fights rather than fight everything.
Fighting everything is how the feminazis got their way
Oh they don’t fight everything, don’t see them boarding planes to go protest in the 90% of other countries around the world that have 0.01% of the womens rights that the U.K. or U.S.A. has.
That is true, like Morons don't recruit outside of religion of peace places, come to think of it Animal rights outside of their butchers.
